wikipedia_page.main:
Sir David Alwyn Gore-Booth  (15 May 1943 – 31 October 2004) was a British diplomat, who served in the FCO from 1964 until 1998.
Sir David was appointed HM Ambassador to Saudi Arabia in 1993, before his final posting as British High Commissioner in New Delhi 1996–1998.  His father, Lord Gore-Booth GCMG was also High Commissioner to India 1960–1965

response: *1996–1998: Sir David Gore-BoothGORE-BOOTH, Hon. Sir David (Alwyn), Who Was Who, A & C Black, 1920–2008; online edn, Oxford University Press, Dec 2012

Lord Gore-Booth was educated at Eton and Balliol. After Oxford, he married in 1940, Patricia Mary Ellerton, by whom he had twin sons one of whom was Sir David Gore-Booth and two daughters. His aunt was the Irish republican and socialist revolutionary, Countess Constance Markievicz (née Gore-Booth).www.thepeerage.com
| Saad Hattar, Corinne Souza, Gerald James, David Gore-Booth, Jenny Moore, Haitham Rashid Al-Withaib, Yosri Fouda
He is a cousin of British portrait painter Glyn Philpot, actors Ronald Colman, Pamela Brown and British diplomat David Gore-Booth.
